image.altText: A vigneron amid vines.

props.synopsis: Four months after an unseasonable frost event wiped out vineyards across south-eastern parts of the country, growers in SA say they are feeling better than expected.

title.children: Months after devastating frost, grape growers are feeling optimistic

image.altText: man and woman smile at camera among vineyard

props.synopsis: The wine industry's peak body hopes it can attract the next generation of growers and producers, but young, first-generation winemakers say nepotism and historical industry connections are barriers to entry.

title.children: One of the world's largest wine industries is facing an aging problem

image.altText: A lady working on a car

props.synopsis: Despite knowing she was a female from a very young age, 53-year-old mechanic Kelli Bennier only accepted herself as a transgender woman a few years ago.

title.children: What it's like being a transgender mechanic in a small city

image.altText: Early morning soft light on wide stretch of River with trees overhanging the water

props.synopsis: Australia has big ambitions for restoring its degraded environment, but the very regulations meant to protect nature could be thwarting that progress.

title.children: Environmental protection laws are stopping nature from being repaired

image.altText: An SA Police officer in uniform.

props.synopsis: Police have described a sequence of fatal crashes as "truly heartbreaking" and have charged a young man with four counts of causing harm by dangerous driving over a crash that has left an 18-year-old woman in a critical condition.

title.children: Driver charged over crash that left 18yo in critical condition, after four deaths on SA roads

image.altText: A black and white camera image of a driver holding a phone with a cat in their lap

props.synopsis: Thousands of drivers continue to be caught on camera using their phones while at the wheel in SA, including one man who allegedly racked up fines of more than $27,000, with police warning that smart watches could also soon be in their sights.

title.children: Driver caught 41 times by mobile phone detection cameras racks up $27,000 in fines, police say

image.altText: A truck hits a car parked on the street.

props.synopsis: A road train driver from Western Australia will face court over a crash at the electorate office of SA state MP Tony Piccolo, where a truck ripped down the verandah and ploughed into parked cars.

title.children: Truck wrecks front of SA MP's electorate office, police arrest driver

image.altText: A red header moves along a paddock harvesting grain with a truck following behind.

props.synopsis: South Australian farmers have grappled with a series of uncontrollable weather conditions that have created one of the most challenging seasons on record.

title.children: South Australian farmers count their losses after worst season in decades

image.altText: A woman stands in a garden holding a basket of vegetables. She wears a blue dress.

props.synopsis: Amid the chaos of motherhood and everyday life, two mums find solace and healing in their gardens.

title.children: Two mums 'grow through what they go through' with veggie patches

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka prepares to serve during the 2024 WTA Finals.

props.synopsis: Defending Australian Open champion and world number one Aryna Sabalenka will hit the court in Brisbane for the first time this tournament, while the United Cup continues in Sydney and Perth. Follow live.

title.children: Sabalenka to begin Brisbane International tilt as Popyrin exits in upset loss

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Brisbane International: Popyrin departs in straight sets
Brisbane International: Popyrin drops first set

image.altText: three people a climbing a sheer rock face on a mountain, holding on to the side

props.synopsis: A Victorian bushwalker in his 30s has died after falling "from height" at Federation Peak, just days after the death of another bushwalker in the same national park.

title.children: Man on trek with partner dies falling 'from height' at Federation Peak

image.altText: Liam Payne leads into microphone

props.synopsis: Prosecutors in Argentina provide a lengthy update on their investigation into former One Direction singer Liam Payne's deadly balcony fall, as a judge alleges the pop star's friend Roger Nores is "criminally responsible".

title.children: Two more charged over death of former One Direction singer Liam Payne

image.altText: Graphic of Google Pay and Apple Pay logos

props.synopsis: Banks are urging customers with Eftpos cards on digital wallets to take action to avoid payment pain come January 1. The Australian share market has opened lower, mimicking losses on Wall Street. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Digital payment problems loom for January 1, ASX opens lower

image.altText: A barista wiping down a coffee machine in a cafe

props.synopsis: Here's a quick look at some of the changes that come into effect when the clock ticks past midnight.

title.children: The laws that will come into effect when the clock strikes midnight

image.altText: Jimmy Carter, right, sits next to Deng Xiaoping.

props.synopsis: Former US president Jimmy Carter is remembered for his transformative role in Asia, including normalising relations with China more than four decades ago.

title.children: 'He was naive': The legacy of Jimmy Carter's breakthrough China policy

image.altText: Trump holds up a hair razor over the head of a man being held by two min in a wrestling ring

props.synopsis: The long hair and sparkly spandex of professional wrestling might seem a long way from the hallowed halls of the Capitol, but perhaps they have more in common than you'd think.

title.children: The WWE tactics Trump has been using to win over voters

image.altText: Stephen Fry wears a black tie at the 68th annual tony awards in 2014

props.synopsis: More than 1,200 people in politics, sport, the arts and community service are recognised on King Charles's New Year's Honours list.

title.children: Stephen Fry and UK Post Office scandal victims in king's honours list

image.altText: Novak Djokovic and Nick Kyrgios chest bump

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios and Novak Djokovic's doubles debut at the Brisbane International felt like a mix between an exhibition and a final. In the end, it didn't matter … it was just tremendously entertaining.

title.children: Whether high theatre or panto parody, Nick and Novak's doubles debut a delight

image.altText: One man puts hand on another sitting down in kitchen

props.synopsis: Kassiou Constructions has been found to have engaged in professional misconduct by the building industry watchdog and received an almost $100,000 fine.

title.children: NT construction company handed record fine for professional misconduct

image.altText: A man and woman stand in front of the remnants of a burned home

props.synopsis: When a major blaze ran through the Grampians in 2006, Rod Marshall and his daughter Kim lost everything but their home. This time around, they weren't so lucky.

title.children: History repeats for Grampians farmers who have now lost home to bushfire

image.altText: woman with blue and purple hair with a black t-shirt, standing outside a cream brick house

props.synopsis: Real estate analysts say homebuyers are benefiting from a drop in house prices in regional Victoria, where Claire and her family have managed to become mortgage-free.

title.children: Claire is mortgage-free thanks to worst-performing property market

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles as he stands in front of an American flag.

props.synopsis: It was a strong year for the ASX, which climbed to 24 new record highs on hopes of interest rate cuts. However, there is likely to be significant volatility in 2025 as investors try to work out the inflationary impacts of US president-elect Donald Trump's trade policies.

title.children: ASX investors may be underestimating Trump's trade wars

image.altText: Fireworks in the night sky.

props.synopsis: Across the country, at the stroke of midnight, fireworks displays explode under the night sky to mark the beginning of a new year. But where does this tradition of celebrating New Year's Eve with fireworks come from?

title.children: Fireworks around the world mark New Year's Eve. But what started the tradition?

image.altText: An aerial shot shows a large building with composite columns surrounded by trees and other large buildings

props.synopsis: The revelation comes as US officials continue to grapple with the fallout of a massive Chinese cyber espionage campaign known as Salt Typhoon.

title.children: US Treasury says Chinese hackers led a 'major cybersecurity' breach

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and orange tinted glasses

props.synopsis: The court issues a written opinion upholding the $US5 million award that the Manhattan jury granted to E Jean Carroll for defamation and sexual abuse.

title.children: Appeals court upholds Trump sexual abuse finding in E Jean Carroll case

image.altText: A pink, orange and purple scarf and a label reading '100% polyester'.

props.synopsis: Synthetic textiles were once hailed as the future of fashion. Now, we all have to reckon with the consequences.

title.children: Most Australians don't know how polyester is made. Here's why that matters

image.altText: Australian fast bowler Mitchell Starc grimaces as he puts his hands on his sides in mid-pitch during a Test.

props.synopsis: Australia savours one of its greatest Test wins before quickly turning attention to the first SCG Test in 20 years to decide a series.

title.children: Selection questions remain ahead of rare Test series decider at the SCG

image.altText: Usman Khawaja shouts as Yashasvi Jaiswal is dismissed at the MCG.

props.synopsis: The 2024 Boxing Day Test goes down as the best-attended cricket game ever in Australia, with tens of thousands watching a drama-filled evening featuring DRS controversy and Travis Head oddity. Here are the quick hits from day five of the fourth Test at the MCG.

title.children: Five quick hits: DRS to rescue for Australia as MCG breaks crowd record

image.altText: A patient foot shackled to a medical bed.

props.synopsis: Prisoners transferred to a hospital for palliative care can be shackled to their beds for their final days. Some experts want to see change.

title.children: Calls for end to use of shackles on prisoners in palliative care

image.altText: A woman pats a cat in a cage

props.synopsis: In a city with up to 1.5 million feral cats, Jakarta vets are at odds about how to tackle the crisis, but some have quietly taken matters into their own hands.

title.children: Why desexing feral cats is turning vets against each other in Jakarta

image.altText: A man kisses a woman.

props.synopsis: Russia and Ukraine exchanged hundreds of prisoners of war in a deal brokered with the help of the United Arab Emirates.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine exchange hundreds of prisoners of war

image.altText: A sketch of a woman with auburn hair standing behind a microphone, as a man in a green longsleeve looks on from afar

props.synopsis: The Frenchman convicted of drugging and raping Gisele Pelicot and soliciting dozens of men to do the same for more than a decade will not appeal his verdict, his lawyer has said.

title.children: Dominique Pelicot will not appeal 20-year sentence

image.altText: A person holds the chin of the baby hippopotamus Moo Deng as they take a photo of it.

props.synopsis: Pop culture moves fast, so you might have missed some of these memes from the year that was. Don't worry, we're here to help you catch up.

title.children: Demure, Moo Deng and Hawk Tuah: 2024 in memes, for better or worse
